line: The Contract of Insurance
label: heading

line: This policy, The Schedule, the enclosed Institute Clauses and the information You provided to Us when applying
label: paragraph

line: for this insurance together with any additional information supplied subsequently form the basis on which this
label: paragraph

line: contract has been arranged.
label: paragraph

line: The policy is not valid unless The Schedule is attached to the policy and has been countersigned by an authorised
label: paragraph

line: official of the Company and bears the Company’s stamp.
label: paragraph

line: Important
label: heading

line: This policy is a legal contract. You must tell Us about any facts or changes which affect Your insurance and which
label: paragraph

line: have occurred either since the policy started or since the last renewal date. If You are not sure whether certain
label: paragraph

line: facts are relevant, please ask Your insurance adviser or local Aviva office. If You do not tell Us about relevant
label: paragraph

line: changes, Your policy may not be valid or the policy may not cover You fully.
label: paragraph

line: You should keep a written record (including copies of letters) of any information You give Us or Your insurance
label: paragraph

line: adviser when You renew this policy.
label: paragraph

line: Introduction
label: heading

line: Welcome to Aviva. We are committed to providing a first-class service. Aviva is the UK’s largest insurer with over
label: paragraph

line: 200 years’ experience in the insurance industry.
label: paragraph

line: This is your insurance policy which sets out your insurance protection in detail. Your premium has been calculated
label: paragraph

line: on the basis of the extent of cover you have selected which is specified in the schedule, the information you have
label: paragraph

line: provided and the declaration you have made.
label: paragraph

line: Please read the policy and the schedule carefully to ensure that the cover meets your requirements. Please
label: paragraph

line: contact your insurance adviser if you have any questions or if you wish to make adjustments.
label: paragraph

line: Contents
label: heading

line: This policy consists of individual sections. You should read this policy in conjunction with the schedule which
label: paragraph

line: confirms the sections you are insured under and gives precise details of the extent of your insurance protection.
label: paragraph

line: Contact details for claims and help
label: heading

line: Services
label: heading

line: As an Aviva customer, you can access additional services to help you keep your business running smoothly. For
label: paragraph

line: our joint protection telephone calls may be recorded and/or monitored.
label: paragraph

line: Claims Service 0161 931 8076
label: heading

line: Our claims line provides you with assistance whenever it is required. When we know about your problem, we will
label: paragraph

line: start to put the solutions in place.
label: paragraph

line: If You are unhappy regarding the handling of a claim, We would encourage You to seek resolution by contacting:
label: paragraph

line: Marine Claims Manager

line: Aviva
label: paragraph

line: Manchester

line: M60 8AD

line: Legal and Tax Helpline 0845 300 1899
label: heading

line: Call this helpline anytime, day or night, for advice on legal or tax matters in the United Kingdom. Given in
label: paragraph

line: confidence, the advice is free and you pay for just the cost of the call.
label: paragraph

line: Commercial Legal Protection 0845 300 1899
label: heading

line: If you have Commercial Legal Protection cover, please call the helpline for legal advice as soon as you are aware
label: paragraph

line: of an incident. Please have your policy number to hand.
label: paragraph

line: If you think you may need to claim, please call the helpline to request a claim form. We can only proceed with your
label: paragraph

line: claim when we have details of the incident in writing.
label: paragraph

line: A claim form is available to download at www.aviva.co.uk/legalprotection.
label: paragraph

line: Risk Solutions Helpline 0845 366 6666
label: heading

line: Call for advice on safety, fire, security and other issues that can affect your business. Most enquiries can be dealt
label: paragraph

line: with over the telephone, but if we can’t give you an immediate answer, we will deal with your enquiry within one
label: paragraph

line: working day. This service is available during office hours with an answering service outside these times.
label: paragraph

line: Counselling Service Helpline 0117 934 0105
label: heading

line: This is a confidential service available to your staff to help deal with personal issues such as bereavement,
label: paragraph

line: divorce, the threat of violence in the workplace and bullying at work.

label: paragraph

line: Complaints Procedure
label: heading

line: Our Promise of Service
label: heading

line: Our goal is to give excellent service to all our customers but we recognise that things do go wrong occasionally.
label: paragraph

line: We take all complaints we receive seriously and aim to resolve all our customers’ problems promptly. To ensure
label: paragraph

line: that we provide the kind of service you expect we welcome your feedback. We will record and analyse your
label: paragraph

line: comments to make sure we continually improve the service we offer.
label: paragraph

line: What will happen if you complain
label: heading

line: n We will acknowledge your complaint promptly.
label: paragraph

line: n We aim to resolve all complaints as quickly as possible.
label: paragraph

line: Most of our customers’ concerns can be resolved quickly but occasionally more detailed enquiries are needed. If
label: paragraph

line: this is likely, we will contact you with an update within 10 working days of receipt and give you an expected date
label: paragraph

line: of response.
label: paragraph

line: What to do should you be dissatisfied
label: heading

line: If you are unhappy with any aspect of the handling of your insurance, we would encourage you, in the first
label: paragraph

line: instance, to seek resolution by contacting your insurance adviser. You can write or telephone, whichever suits you,
label: paragraph

line: and ask your contact to review the problem.
label: paragraph

line: If you are unhappy regarding the handling of a claim, we would encourage you to seek resolution by contacting:
label: paragraph

line: Marine Claims Manager
label: paragraph

line: Aviva
label: paragraph

line: 2/10 Albert Square
label: paragraph

line: Manchester
label: paragraph

line: M60 8AD
label: paragraph

line: E-mail: cargo-claims@aviva.co.uk
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: Telephone:
label: paragraph

line: 0800 023 4567 (free from landlines) or
label: paragraph

line: 0300 123 9123 (free from most mobile phones)
label: paragraph

line: Or simply log on to their website at www.financial-ombudsman.org.uk.
label: paragraph

line: Whilst we are bound by the decision of the FOS, you are not. Following the complaints procedure does not affect
label: paragraph

line: your right to take legal action.

line: Section One – Policy Definitions
label: heading

line: Each time We use one of the words or phrases listed below, it will have the same meaning wherever it appears in
label: paragraph

line: Your policy unless We state otherwise. A defined word or phrase will start with a capital letter each time it appears
label: paragraph

line: in the policy, except when used in headings and titles.
label: paragraph

line: Each Section of the policy contains definitions which apply to that particular section and they must be read in
label: paragraph

line: conjunction with the following policy definitions.
label: paragraph

line: Certificate of Insurance
label: heading

line: The document produced by Us (or on Our behalf) as evidence of insurance.
label: paragraph

line: The Schedule
label: heading

line: The document which specifies details of The Policyholder, subject matter insured and any excesses,
label: paragraph

line: endorsements and conditions applying to the policy.
label: paragraph

line: We/Us/Our/Aviva
label: heading

line: Aviva Insurance Limited.
label: paragraph

line: You/Your/The Policyholder
label: heading

line: The persons, companies, partnerships or unincorporated associations named in The Schedule as The
label: paragraph

line: Policyholder.
label: paragraph

line: Section Two – General Conditions
label: heading

line: The following conditions apply to Your policy.
label: paragraph

line: (1) Cancellation
label: heading

line: This insurance may be cancelled at any time in writing by either You or Us giving
label: paragraph

line: (a) 7 days notice in respect of risks covered by the Institute War Clauses.
label: paragraph

line: (b) 7 days (or 48 hours in respect of shipments to or from the United States of America) notice in respect of
label: paragraph

line: risks covered by the Institute Strikes Clauses.
label: paragraph

line: (c) 30 days notice in respect of all other risks.
label: paragraph

line: Notice shall commence at midnight on the day when it was issued but cancellation shall not apply to any risks
label: paragraph

line: which have attached in accordance with the terms of this policy before the cancellation becomes effective.
label: paragraph

line: (2) Certificates
label: heading

line: If We provide You with and/or authorise You to issue certificates it is a condition that You
label: paragraph

line: (a) only use certificates for shipments which are covered by this policy.
label: paragraph

line: (b) do not amend the printed policy conditions or exceed the shipment limit specified in The Schedule without
label: paragraph

line: Our prior written approval.
label: paragraph

line: (c) ensure each certificate is properly countersigned by one of Your authorised representatives.
label: paragraph

line: (d) provide Us with a copy of each completed certificate in accordance with the declaration procedure
label: paragraph

line: specified and return any spoilt certificates to Us.
label: paragraph

line: (e) never complete a certificate after known loss or damage without Our prior written approval.
label: paragraph

line: (f) keep the stock of certificates in a safe place and return them to Us immediately upon Our request.
label: paragraph

line: These conditions also apply where We have authorised You to prepare certificates using Our validity labels.
label: paragraph

line: (3) Declaration
label: heading

line: It is a condition of this contract that You declare every consignment without exception to Us as soon as
label: paragraph

line: possible in accordance with the basis of valuation and the declaration procedure specified in The Schedule.
label: paragraph

line: We will accept up to, but not exceeding, the sum specified in The Schedule in respect of any one vessel,
label: paragraph

line: aircraft or conveyance. Where the policy is subject to periodic declaration, You should carefully record details
label: paragraph

line: of the shipments in the manner agreed and submit each declaration to Us as soon as possible after the end of
label: paragraph

line: each declaration period to enable Us to calculate any additional premium due.
label: paragraph

line: We may, at any reasonable time, inspect Your records to check compliance with the procedures set out above.
label: paragraph

line: (4) Errors and Omissions
label: heading

line: You will not lose your right to indemnity due to unintentional error or omission in declaring consignments under
label: paragraph

line: this policy to Us, provided that You advise Us of such errors or omissions as soon as You are aware of them.
label: paragraph

line: (5) Marine Insurance Act (1906)
label: heading

line: The conditions and warranties of the above Act shall apply to all transits and voyages covered by this
label: paragraph

line: insurance except where they conflict with the other provisions of this policy.
label: paragraph

line: (6) Non Contribution
label: heading

line: We will not pay for any loss, damage or expense to the subject matter insured which, If this insurance did not
label: paragraph

line: exist, is or would be covered at the time of such loss, damage or expense under any other insurance. In such
label: paragraph

line: circumstances We shall only pay for any excess beyond the amount that would have been payable under the
label: paragraph

line: other Insurance if this insurance had not been effected.
label: paragraph

line: (7) (a) Own Vehicle Conditions
label: heading

line: The following conditions shall apply to any Vehicle owned by You or under Your control containing the subject
label: paragraph

line: matter insured:
label: paragraph

line: (1) It is a condition of this policy that:
label: paragraph

line: (i) the Vehicle is maintained in an efficient and roadworthy condition
label: paragraph

line: (ii) all ropes, sheets, tarpaulins and the like are maintained in an efficient condition
label: paragraph

line: (iii) all protective appliances and locking devices are installed in accordance with the manufacturers’
label: paragraph

line: recommendations, in operation, properly and suitably maintained and neither withdrawn nor varied
label: paragraph

line: without Our consent.
label: paragraph

line: (2a) When a Vehicle is left loaded and Unattended during the ordinary course of transit the following conditions
label: paragraph

line: shall also apply
label: paragraph

line: (i) the ignition key shall be removed from the Vehicle
label: paragraph

line: (ii) all doors, windows and other openings shall be securely closed and properly fastened
label: paragraph

line: (iii) all protective appliances, alarms, immobilisers and locking devices shall be put into effect in
label: paragraph

line: accordance with the manufacturers’ instructions
label: paragraph

line: (iv) if the Vehicle is fitted with a boot or similar compartment the subject matter insured must be kept there
label: paragraph

line: (v) if the Vehicle is an estate or a hatchback Vehicle the subject matter insured must be kept under the
label: paragraph

line: load cover or parcel shelf or otherwise covered over and hidden from view
label: paragraph

line: (2b) We will not pay for any loss of or damage to the subject matter insured caused by theft if the Vehicle is
label: paragraph

line: loaded and Unattended during the ordinary course of transit at the end of any normal working day or on
label: paragraph

line: any non-working days unless the Vehicle is
label: paragraph

line: (i) kept in a fully enclosed, securely locked building of Substantial Construction
label: paragraph

line: or
label: paragraph

line: (ii) in a permanently attended Vehicle security park or compound secured by locked gates
label: paragraph

line: or
label: paragraph

line: (iii) in a public car park with an authorised attendant on duty at all times
label: paragraph

line: (b) Own Vehicle Overnight Co-Insurance Conditions
label: heading

line: If You are unable to comply with part (2b) of the Own Vehicle Conditions then We may elect:
label: paragraph

line: (i) to treat You as your own insurer for 20% of the total sum insured in respect of the subject matter
label: paragraph

line: insured,
label: paragraph

line: or
label: paragraph

line: (ii) that You shall bear the first £500 of each and every claim,
label: paragraph

line: whichever is the greater.
label: paragraph

line: (c) Definitions
label: heading

line: The following definitions apply for the purpose of these conditions:
label: paragraph

line: Vehicle
label: heading

line: Any road vehicle and shall include any trailer or trailers or container or containers combined.
label: paragraph

line: Unattended
label: heading

line: With no authorised person(s) authorised by You keeping the Vehicle under observation, and able
label: paragraph

line: to observe or prevent any attempt to interfere with it with a reasonable prospect of preventing any
label: paragraph

line: unauthorised interference.
label: paragraph

line: Substantial Construction
label: heading

line: Built only of brick and/or stone and/or concrete and/or steel frame and steel construction and/or plastic
label: paragraph

line: coated metal profile sheet above brick with a slate and/or tiled and/or metal and/or asbestos and/or
label: paragraph

line: concrete roof
label: paragraph

line: (8) Subjectivity Condition
label: heading

line: The policy, the application form, statement of fact and/or declaration made by You, and any clauses endorsed on
label: paragraph

line: the policy and The Schedule should be read together and form the contract of insurance between You and Us.
label: paragraph

line: We will clearly state if the cover provided by the policy is subject to You:
label: paragraph

line: (a) providing Us with any additional information requested by the required date(s)
label: paragraph

line: (b) completing any actions agreed between You and Us by the required date(s)
label: paragraph

line: (c) allowing Us to complete any actions agreed between You and Us.
label: paragraph

line: Upon completion of these requirements (or if they are not completed by the required dates), We may, at our
label: paragraph

line: option:
label: paragraph

line: (a) modify Your premium
label: paragraph

line: (b) issue a mid-term amendment to Your policy terms and conditions
label: paragraph

line: (c) require You to make alterations to the risk insured by the required date(s)
label: paragraph

line: (d) exercise Our right to cancel Your policy
label: paragraph

line: (e) leave the policy terms and conditions, and Your premium, unaltered.
label: paragraph

line: We will contact You with our decision and where applicable, specify the date(s) by which any action(s) agreed
label: paragraph

line: need to be completed by You and/or any decision by Us will take effect.
label: paragraph

line: Our requirements and decisions will take effect from the date(s) specified unless and until We agree otherwise
label: paragraph

line: in writing. If You disagree with Our requirements and/or decisions, We will consider Your comments and where
label: paragraph

line: We consider appropriate, will continue to negotiate with You to resolve the matter to Your and Our satisfaction.
label: paragraph

line: In the event that the matter cannot be resolved:
label: paragraph

line: (a) You have the right to cancel this policy from a date agreed by You and Us and, providing no claims have
label: paragraph

line: been made, We will refund a proportionate part of the premium paid for the unexpired period of cover
label: paragraph

line: (b) We may, at our option, exercise Our right under the policy cancellation condition.
label: paragraph

line: Except where stated all other policy terms and conditions will continue to apply.
label: paragraph

line: The above conditions do not affect Our right to void the policy if We discover information material to Our
label: paragraph

line: acceptance of the risk. Please refer to the Important Note within the Contract of Insurance page of Your policy
label: paragraph

line: booklet.
label: paragraph

line: (9) Warranty
label: heading

line: A warranty must be strictly complied with and failure to do so may result in the policy being deemed void from
label: paragraph

line: inception or last renewal date or from the time of the breach of warranty or may entitle us to avoid liability for
label: paragraph

line: loss, damage or expense whether or not this resulted from the breach of warranty.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 9
label: paragraph

line: Section Three - Additional Cover
label: heading

line: This Section has been specially designed to protect Your business interests and Your brand and extends the
label: paragraph

line: policy cover beyond the protection provided by the Institute and Joint Cargo Committee Clauses, subject to the
label: paragraph

line: terms and conditions of the policy.
label: paragraph

line: All of the following covers apply to Your policy
label: paragraph

line: General Average
label: heading

line: We will pay general average and salvage charges in full without reference to insured and contributory values.
label: paragraph

line: Labels
label: heading

line: In the event of loss or damage recoverable under this policy which affects only the labels, wrappers and/or
label: paragraph

line: capsules of the subject matter insured We will pay only for the cost of new labels, wrappers and/or capsules and
label: paragraph

line: the cost of re-labelling.
label: paragraph

line: The maximum amount We will pay under this cover will not exceed the sum insured of the subject matter which is
label: paragraph

line: being relabelled/re-wrapped and/or re-encapsulated.
label: paragraph

line: Pairs and Sets
label: heading

line: If the subject matter insured consists of articles which form a pair or set We will pay only for the proportionate
label: paragraph

line: sum insured of the article lost or damaged, without reference to any special value the damaged article may have
label: paragraph

line: as part of a pair or set.
label: paragraph

line: Transit Clause Extension
label: heading

line: The Duration - Transit Clause 8.8.1 of the Institute Cargo Clauses (A) CL382 01/01/2009 is extended so that
label: paragraph

line: this insurance attaches from the time the subject matter insured is first moved in the warehouse or at place of
label: paragraph

line: storage (at the place named in the contract of insurance) for the purpose of the immediate loading into or onto the
label: paragraph

line: carrying vehicle or other conveyance for the commencement of transit or for the purpose of temporary storage
label: paragraph

line: on the carrying vehicle or other conveyance for a period not exceeding 96 consecutive hours when within Your
label: paragraph

line: custody and control and continues in accordance with the Clause throughout the ordinary course of transit and
label: paragraph

line: until loaded at the place where this insurance terminates.
label: paragraph

line: When the subject matter insured is stored on a Vehicle under Your custody and control the terms and conditions
label: paragraph

line: of the Own Vehicle Conditions must be fully complied with.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 10
label: paragraph

line: Section Four – Special Conditions
label: heading

line: All of the following Special Conditions apply to Your policy.
label: paragraph

line: Derangement Clause
label: heading

line: Excluding electrical, mechanical and/or electronic derangement unless caused by a peril insured against.
label: paragraph

line: Postal Sendings
label: heading

line: If the subject matter insured is despatched by postal services and valued £1,000 or more per package and/or
label: paragraph

line: parcel it must be
label: paragraph

line: (1) insured for the minimum amount available with the postal service
label: paragraph

line: or
label: paragraph

line: (2) despatched via a system which provides evidence of both posting and delivery
label: paragraph

line: Process
label: heading

line: We will not pay for any loss or damage to the subject matter insured, which is due to or directly results from any
label: paragraph

line: process of use, testing or repair.
label: paragraph

line: Second-hand and/or Used and/or Damaged And/or Unpacked Goods
label: heading

line: We will not pay for any loss of or damage to:
label: paragraph

line: n second-hand and/or used goods which have not been fully reconditioned and/or refurbished
label: paragraph

line: n damaged goods
label: paragraph

line: n unpacked goods
label: paragraph

line: which is attributable to:
label: paragraph

line: n rust, oxidation and/or discoloration
label: paragraph

line: n chipping, denting, scratching, bruising and cost of repainting
label: paragraph

line: n twisting, bending and distortion
label: paragraph

line: unless it can be proved that such loss or damage has occurred as a result of a peril insured against during the
label: paragraph

line: insured transit.
label: paragraph

line: Section Five – Institute and Joint Cargo Committee Clauses
label: heading

line: The following clauses are standard marine market wordings. The Institute Clauses referred to in the policy, The
label: paragraph

line: Schedule and endorsements are those current at the inception of this contract. If these clauses are revised during
label: paragraph

line: the period of the contract, and provided we give You at least 30 days notice, the revised Institute Clauses shall
label: paragraph

line: apply to risks which attach on or after the date of expiry of this notice.
label: paragraph

line: Cargo ISM Endorsement JC 98/019
label: heading

line: Applicable to shipments on board Ro-Ro passenger ferries.
label: paragraph

line: Applicable with effect from 01 July 1998 to shipments on board
label: paragraph

line: (1) passenger vessels transporting more than 12 passengers
label: paragraph

line: and
label: paragraph

line: (2) oil tankers, chemical tankers, gas carriers, bulk carriers
label: paragraph

line: and
label: paragraph

line: (3) cargo high speed craft of 500 gt or more
label: paragraph

line: Applicable with effect from 01 July 2002 to shipments on board all other cargo ships and mobile offshore drilling
label: paragraph

line: units of 500gt or more.
label: paragraph

line: In no case shall this insurance cover loss, damage or expense where the subject matter insured is carried
label: paragraph

line: by a vessel that is not ISM Code certified or whose owners or operators do not hold ISM Code Document of
label: paragraph

line: Compliance when, at the time of loading of the subject matter insured on board the vessel, You were aware, or in
label: paragraph

line: the ordinary course of business should have been aware
label: paragraph

line: (a) either that such vessel was not certified in accordance with the ISM Code or
label: paragraph

line: (b) that a current ISM Code Document of Compliance was not held by her owners or operators as required under
label: paragraph

line: the SOLAS Convention 1974 as amended.
label: paragraph

line: This exclusion shall not apply where this insurance has been assigned to the party claiming hereunder who has
label: paragraph

line: bought or agreed to buy the subject matter insured in good faith under a binding contract.
label: paragraph

line: Cargo ISM Forwarding Charges Clause
label: heading

line: (For use only with JCC Cargo ISM Endorsement JC 98/019)
label: paragraph

line: In consideration of an additional premium to be agreed, this insurance is extended to reimburse You, up to the
label: paragraph

line: limit of the sum insured for the voyage, for any extra charges properly and reasonably incurred in unloading,
label: paragraph

line: storing and forwarding the subject matter to the destination to which it is insured hereunder following release of
label: paragraph

line: cargo from a vessel arrested or detained at or diverted to any other port or place (other than the intended port of
label: paragraph

line: destination) where the voyage is terminated due to either
label: paragraph

line: (a) such vessel not being certified in accordance with the ISM Code or
label: paragraph

line: (b) a current ISM Code Document of Compliance not being held by her owners or operators as required under the
label: paragraph

line: SOLAS Convention 1974 as amended.
label: paragraph

line: This clause, which does not apply to General Average or Salvage or Salvage Charges, is subject to all other terms
label: paragraph

line: conditions and exclusions contained in the policy and to JCC Cargo ISM Endorsement JC98/019.
label: paragraph

line: Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999
label: heading

line: Exclusion Clause (Cargo) JC – 2000/02
label: heading

line: The Provisions of the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 do not apply to this insurance or to any certificate(s)
label: paragraph

line: of insurance issued hereunder. Neither this insurance nor any certificates issued hereunder confer any benefits on any
label: paragraph

line: third parties. No third party may enforce any term of this insurance or of any certificate issued hereunder. This clause
label: paragraph

line: shall not affect the rights of the assured (as assignee or otherwise) or the rights of any loss payee.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 12
label: paragraph

line: Institute Classification Clause CL354 - 01/01/2001
label: heading

line: Qualifying Vessels
label: heading

line: (1) This insurance and the marine transit rates as agreed in the policy or open cover apply only to cargoes and/
label: paragraph

line: or interests carried by mechanically self-propelled vessels of steel construction classed with a Classification
label: paragraph

line: Society which is
label: paragraph

line: 1.1 a Member or Associate Member of the International Association of Classification Societies (IACS)*
label: paragraph

line: or
label: paragraph

line: 1.2 a National Flag Society as defined in Clause 4 below, but only where the vessel is engaged exclusively in
label: paragraph

line: the coastal trading of that nation (including trading on an inter-island route within an archipelago of which that
label: paragraph

line: nation forms part).
label: paragraph

line: Cargoes and/or interests carried by vessels not classed as above must be notified promptly to underwriters
label: paragraph

line: for rates and conditions to be agreed. Should a loss occur prior to such agreement being obtained cover
label: paragraph

line: may be provided but only if cover would have been available at a reasonable commercial market rate
label: paragraph

line: on reasonable commercial market terms.
label: paragraph

line: Age Limitation
label: heading

line: (2) Cargoes and/or interests carried by Qualifying Vessels (as defined above) which exceed the following age
label: paragraph

line: limits will be insured on the policy or open cover conditions subject to an additional premium to be agreed.
label: paragraph

line: Bulk or combination carriers over 10 years of age or other vessels over 15 years of age unless they
label: paragraph

line: 2.1 have been used for the carriage of general cargo on an established and regular pattern of trading between
label: paragraph

line: a range of specified ports, and do not exceed 25 years of age
label: paragraph

line: or
label: paragraph

line: 2.2 were constructed as containerships, vehicle carriers or double-skin open-hatch gantry crane vessels
label: paragraph

line: (OHGCs) and have been continuously used as such on an established and regular pattern of trading between
label: paragraph

line: a range of specified ports, and do not exceed 30 years of age.
label: paragraph

line: Craft Clause
label: heading

line: (3) The requirements of this Clause do not apply to any craft used to load or unload the vessel within the port area
label: paragraph

line: National Flag Society
label: heading

line: (4) A National Flag Society is a Classification Society which is domiciled in the same country as the owner of the
label: paragraph

line: vessel in question which must also operate under the flag of that country.
label: paragraph

line: Prompt Notice
label: heading

line: (5) Where this insurance requires You to give prompt notice to Us, the right to cover is dependent upon
label: paragraph

line: compliance with that obligation.
label: paragraph

line: Law and Practice
label: heading

line: (6) This insurance is subject to English Law and practice.
label: paragraph

line: * For a current list of IACS Members and Associate Members please refer to the IACS website
label: paragraph

line: www.iacs.org.uk
label: paragraph

line: Institute Radioactive Contamination Chemical, Biological, Bio-Chemical and Electromagnetic Weapons
label: heading

line: Exclusion Clause – CL370
label: heading

line: This clause shall be paramount and shall override anything contained in this insurance inconsistent
label: paragraph

line: therewith
label: paragraph

line: (1) In no case shall this insurance cover loss damage liability or expense directly or indirectly caused by or
label: paragraph

line: contributed to by or arising from
label: paragraph

line: 1.1 ionising radiations from or contamination by radioactivity from any nuclear fuel or from any nuclear waste
label: paragraph

line: or from the combustion of nuclear fuel
label: paragraph

line: 1.2 the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other hazardous or contaminating properties of any nuclear installation,
label: paragraph

line: reactor or other nuclear assembly or nuclear component thereof
label: paragraph

line: 1.3 any weapon or device employing atomic or nuclear fission and/or fusion or other like reaction or
label: paragraph

line: radioactive force or matter
label: paragraph

line: 1.4 the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other hazardous or contaminating properties of any radioactive matter.
label: paragraph

line: The exclusion in this sub-clause does not extend to radioactive isotopes, other than nuclear fuel, when such
label: paragraph

line: isotopes are being prepared, carried, stored, or used for commercial, agricultural, medical, scientific or other
label: paragraph

line: similar peaceful purposes
label: paragraph

line: 1.5 any chemical, biological, bio-chemical, or electromagnetic weapon.
label: paragraph

line: Termination of Transit Clause (Terrorism) – JC 2009/056 – 01/01/2009
label: heading

line: This clause shall be paramount and shall override anything contained in this insurance inconsistent
label: paragraph

line: therewith.
label: paragraph

line: (1) Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained in the contract of Insurance or the Clauses referred to
label: paragraph

line: therein, it is agreed that in so far as this policy covers loss of or damage to the subject-matter insured caused
label: paragraph

line: by
label: paragraph

line: any act of terrorism being an act of any person acting on behalf of, or in connection with, any organisation
label: paragraph

line: which carries out activities directed towards the overthrowing or influencing, by force or violence, of any
label: paragraph

line: government whether or not legally constituted or
label: paragraph

line: any person acting from a political, ideological or religious motive,
label: paragraph

line: such cover is conditional upon the subject-matter insured being in the ordinary course of transit and, in any
label: paragraph

line: event, SHALL TERMINATE:
label: paragraph

line: either
label: paragraph

line: 1.1 as per the transit clauses contained within the policy, or
label: paragraph

line: 1.2 on completion of unloading from the carrying vehicle or other conveyance in or at the final warehouse or
label: paragraph

line: place of storage at the destination named in the contract of insurance, or
label: paragraph

line: 1.3 on completion of unloading from the carrying vehicle or other conveyance in or at any other warehouse
label: paragraph

line: or place of storage, whether prior to or at the destination named in the contract of insurance, which You or
label: paragraph

line: Your employees elect to use either for storage other than in the ordinary course of transit or for allocation or
label: paragraph

line: distribution, or
label: paragraph

line: 1.4 when You or Your employees elect to use any carrying vehicle or other conveyance or any container for
label: paragraph

line: storage other than in the ordinary course of transit, or
label: paragraph

line: 1.5 in respect of marine transits, on the expiry of 60 days after completion of discharge over side of the
label: paragraph

line: subject matter insured from the oversea vessel at the final port of discharge, or
label: paragraph

line: 1.6 in respect of air transits, on the expiry of 30 days after unloading the subject-matter insured from the
label: paragraph

line: aircraft at the final place of discharge,
label: paragraph

line: whichever shall occur first.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 14
label: paragraph

line: (2) If the contract of insurance or the Clauses referred to therein specifically provide cover for inland or other
label: paragraph

line: further transits following on from storage, or termination as provided for above, cover will re-attach, and
label: paragraph

line: continues during the ordinary course of that transit terminating again in accordance with clause 1.
label: paragraph

line: Institute Replacement Clause CL372 - 01/12/2008 – in respect of New Goods only
label: heading

line: In the event of loss of or damage to any part(s) of an insured machine or other manufactured item consisting of
label: paragraph

line: more than one part caused by a peril covered by this insurance, the sum recoverable shall not exceed the cost
label: paragraph

line: of replacement or repair of such part(s) plus labour for (re)fitting and carriage costs. Duty incurred in the provision
label: paragraph

line: of replacement or repaired part(s) shall also be recoverable provided that the full duty payable on the insured
label: paragraph

line: machine or manufactured item is included in the amount insured.
label: paragraph

line: Our total liability shall in no event exceed the amount insured of the machine or manufactured item.
label: paragraph

line: Institute Replacement Clause – Proportional Valuation CL373 - 01/12/2008 – in respect of Secondhand &/or
label: heading

line: Used Goods only
label: heading

line: In the event of loss of or damage to any part(s) of an insured machine or other manufactured item consisting
label: paragraph

line: of more than one part caused by a peril covered by this insurance, the sum recoverable shall not exceed such
label: paragraph

line: proportion of the cost of replacement or repair of such part(s) as the amount bears to the new cost of the machine
label: paragraph

line: or manufactured item, plus labour for (re)fitting and carriage costs. Duty incurred in the provision of replacement
label: paragraph

line: or repaired part(s) shall also be recoverable provided that the full duty payable on the insured machine or
label: paragraph

line: manufactured item is included in the amount insured.
label: paragraph

line: Our total liability shall in no event exceed the amount insured of the machine or manufactured item.
label: paragraph

line: Institute Replacement Clause – Obsolete Parts Endorsement JC2008/023) – (as applicable)
label: heading

line: (for use only with the Institute Replacement Clause CL372 - 01/12/2008 or Institute Replacement Clause –
label: paragraph

line: Proportional Valuation CL373 - 01/12/2008)
label: paragraph

line: In the event of a claim recoverable under this policy necessitating the manufacture of any new part(s) for the repair
label: paragraph

line: of an insured machine or other manufactured item, the sum recoverable shall not exceed the manufacturer’s
label: paragraph

line: last list price for the year of manufacture of the lost or damaged part(s), uplifted for inflation. Inflation shall be
label: paragraph

line: determined by reference to the Retail Price Index, or other officially published data of the country of manufacture
label: paragraph

line: of the insured machine or manufactured item, up to a maximum total uplift of 25%.
label: paragraph

line: If no such manufacturer’s list price is available, the total liability shall in no event exceed the amount insured of the
label: paragraph

line: machine or manufactured item.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 15
label: paragraph

line: Section Six – Claims Procedure
label: heading

line: In the event of any loss or damage for which We may be liable it is essential that You and/or Your agent follow the
label: paragraph

line: following procedures.
label: paragraph

line: (1) Do not give a clean receipt where goods are in a doubtful condition (except under written protest)
label: heading

line: You must note on the delivery receipt any discrepancies such as shortage, non-delivery, leakage, and damage
label: paragraph

line: including that which may only be superficial damage to the outer packaging such as denting, scuffing, staining
label: paragraph

line: etc.
label: paragraph

line: (2) Report potential claims immediately to Us
label: heading

line: This must be done by telephone, email or facsimile (fax) to the local office noted as follows:
label: paragraph

line: Marine Claims Manager
label: paragraph

line: Aviva
label: paragraph

line: 2/10 Albert Square
label: paragraph

line: Manchester
label: paragraph

line: M60 8AD
label: paragraph

line: E-mail: cargo-claims@aviva.co.uk
label: paragraph

line: or Claims Settling agent shown on the policy or Certificate of Insurance.
label: paragraph

line: This notice must include
label: paragraph

line: (a) the location of the consignment
label: paragraph

line: (b) contact names and numbers
label: paragraph

line: (c) a brief description of the extent of loss and/or damage
label: paragraph

line: A decision will then be made whether to appoint a surveyor or investigator.
label: paragraph

line: Advice will be given regarding what action should be taken next to pursue the claim.
label: paragraph

line: (3) Immediate notification must be given to carriers and bailees by telephone or fax
label: heading

line: This will allow them the opportunity to inspect the damage or commence tracer action for missing or short
label: paragraph

line: delivered goods.
label: paragraph

line: In the event of non-delivery notice must be given as soon as it becomes apparent that the goods have not
label: paragraph

line: been received when expected.
label: paragraph

line: (4) Write to carriers and other bailees within 3 Days of delivery holding them responsible for the loss and/
label: heading

line: or damage
label: heading

line: The time limits for providing notice of claim vary between the different Conditions of Carriage or Bailment
label: paragraph

line: but timescales are generally very short and failure to provide notification of claim within these timescales will
label: paragraph

line: enable carriers and bailees to repudiate valid claims.
label: paragraph

line: It is Your duty and Your agents’ to take steps to protect and preserve the rights and remedies available
label: paragraph

line: to Us.
label: paragraph

line: These are the rights under subrogation which enable insurers to stand in place of the insured once the
label: paragraph

line: insurance claim has been paid and recover from the parties responsible for the loss an amount up to but not
label: paragraph

line: exceeding the amount of the claim settlement
label: paragraph

line: (5) Formal claim against Carriers and Bailees
label: heading

line: When the extent of the loss and/or damage has been quantified a costed claim must be submitted to the
label: paragraph

line: responsible party together with supporting documentation.
label: paragraph

line: If there are likely to be delays in quantifying the claim, estimates must be submitted within a reasonable time
label: paragraph

line: and an acknowledgement of receipt sought.
label: paragraph

line: Note – As with initial notification of claim the formal claim must be submitted to carriers and/or bailees
label: paragraph

line: within the timescales laid down in the Conditions of Carriage or Bailment (usually 9 and 12 months) in
label: paragraph

line: order to prevent valid claims being declined.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 16
label: paragraph

line: (6) Notify to the police
label: heading

line: As soon as reasonably possible, any loss or damage caused by theft or malicious damage must be notified to
label: paragraph

line: the police and a crime number obtained.
label: paragraph

line: (7) Documents required to evidence the claim
label: heading

line: (a) original Certificate of Insurance or policy or policy and Declaration reference (as applicable) (b) original
label: paragraph

line: sales or commercial invoices
label: paragraph

line: (c) original transit and consignment documents eg.’‘Shipped’’ Bill of Lading, Carrier Air Waybill, House Air
label: paragraph

line: Waybill, CMR Note, Certificate of Shipment, Rail Consignment Note and/or other contracts of carriage
label: paragraph

line: (d) Packing Lists (to identify the goods actually packed in each carton, case, etc.)
label: paragraph

line: (e) Receipts issued during transit and at delivery Landing (or Short landing) Accounts, Weight Notes, Delivery
label: paragraph

line: Receipts and similar documents
label: paragraph

line: (f) Survey report (if issued)
label: paragraph

line: (g) Repair and/or replacement estimates
label: paragraph

line: (h) Other documentary evidence
label: paragraph

line: (i) Statement of claim
label: paragraph

line: (j) Details of the loss and/or damage including a calculation or estimate of the claim amount.
label: paragraph

line: (k) copies of all correspondence exchanged with the carriers, bailees, suppliers and other parties regarding
label: paragraph

line: their liability for the loss and/or damage.
label: paragraph

line: BCIMM9356_F_97000743_POB.indd 17
label: paragraph
